oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville, Chattanooga & St. Louis Railway Timetable
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Taking effect July 4, 1875 at 4:30 p.m., a timetable was provided for the government and for the information of railroad employees. It included special instructions such as "RUN NO RISKS, TAKE THE SAFE SIDE IN CASE OF DOUBT." The NC & St. L was established in 1873 from the Nashville and Chattanooga Railroad. It formally merged with the Louisville & Nashville Railroad in 1957.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
